p: Previously, new drugs were discovered mostly by a “trial and error” approach ( Butcher et al., 2004). As methods and knowledge in chemistry advance, researchers began to purify the active compounds in herbal extracts known to have medicinal properties and determine their structures ( Drews, 2000). The emergence of genomics and proteomics and the development of bioinformatics and cheminformatics made a breakthrough into the drug design, bringing the concept and techniques for large-scale screening. Newly emerging diseases require faster pace of drug development. Worldwide transmission of COVID-19 ( van Dorp et al., 2020) and high infectivity ( Zhang and Holmes, 2020) of the virus demands rapid development of suitable drugs.
